intro: Uvaria setigera, commonly known as the slender uvaria, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are small, fleshy berries that turn red when mature. Uvaria setigera is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
